At just 11 inches tall, Reachy Mini brings real-world AI to your desk ‚Äî programmable in Python, powered by the Hugging Face Hub, and ready to run apps like face tracking, speech recognition, and generative AI.

News üì∞Ô∏è
1.)
Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
Tennis Players Criticize AI Technology Used By Wimbledon
| TechCrunch.com | July 7, 2025
Some tennis players are unhappy with the implementation of AI line judges at Wimbledon, citing inaccuracies that led to critical match disruptions. Players like Emma Raducanu and Jack Draper voiced concerns about the technology‚Äôs reliability, while an incident occurred where the AI failed to call an out ball, prompting an official human intervention. Wimbledon organizers are facing backlash as they adjust their automated systems amidst ongoing critiques.
B.)
This AI Band Went Viral ‚Äî Here‚Äôs How They Did It!
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | July 5, 2025
Delve into the rise of Spotify‚Äôs innovative AI Band, exploring its unique sound and significance in the evolving landscape of music. Learn how to create your own AI music and album art, while navigating the process to release your tracks on Spotify.
C.)
The AI Invasion Of YouTube (And Hollywood) Has Begun‚Ä¶
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 7, 2025
The job market is witnessing unusual trends as companies focus on increasing productivity through AI tools rather than hiring new employees. Meanwhile, an AI-generated animated series, Cat Biggie, is set to premiere on YouTube, exemplifying the significant penetration of AI in the entertainment industry.
D.)
GTA AI Is Here & WILD! (And You Can Play It!)
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | July 4, 2025
Explore the revolutionary advancements in gaming with the introduction of AI-generated worlds in ‚ÄòMirage,‚Äô a game that allows players to generate their adventures in real-time using text prompts. Delve into the mind-blowing capabilities of this new technology and what it means for the future of interactive entertainment.
E.)
Inside ChatGPT, AI Assistants, And Building At OpenAI ‚Äî The OpenAI Podcast Ep. 2
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | July 1, 2025
Nick Turley and Mark Chen delve into the factors behind ChatGPT‚Äôs unexpected success and examine the complexities of reasoning within AI systems. Their conversation explores the future of AI development, addressing challenges in agentic coding and the evolution of multimodal assistants.

5.)
Uber CEO Making Autonomous Burritos?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 14, 2025
Ex-Uber CEO Travis Kalanick is making waves with his new venture in food automation, launching fully robotic restaurants dubbed ‚ÄòCloud Kitchens‚Äô.
6.)
Discover Tools That Work With Claude
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | July 14, 2025
A new directory of tools connecting directly to Claude has been launched, allowing for seamless integration with applications like Notion, Canva, Figma, and Stripe. This functionality empowers users to manage their projects, understand deadlines, and work efficiently within their preferred tools.
7.)
Kimi K2 Is Insane‚Ä¶ (Open-Source Is Back!)
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 14, 2025
Kimi K2 marks a significant advancement in open-source technology, showcasing its capabilities and innovations. This episode features an in-depth exploration of the latest developments, insights from experts, and discussions highlighting the resurgence of community-driven solutions.
8.)
The Best AI Video Restyle Yet!
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | July 14, 2025
Dive into innovative AI tools with a focus on Mago‚Äôs groundbreaking video-to-video restyler, which addresses key challenges like lip-syncing. Additionally, gain insights into HiggsField‚Äôs character consistency feature and explore Magnific‚Äôs non-creative AI image upscaler, both of which are poised to elevate your content creation experience.
9.)
Meta To Invest Hundreds Of Billions In AI Supercomputing Initiative
| Mark Zuckerberg | Threads.com | July 14, 2025
For our superintelligence effort, I‚Äôm focused on building the most elite and talent-dense team in the industry. We‚Äôre also going to invest hundreds of billions of dollars into compute to build superintelligence. We have the capital from our business to do this.
10.)
Elon Musk‚ÄôS Grok AI Adds Anime Companion Featuring Nsfw Mode
| TheVerge.com | July 14, 2025
People who pay for access to SuperGrok can now try the AI chatbot‚Äôs new ‚ÄúCompanions‚Äù avatars, xAI owner Elon Musk announced Monday morning. The companions available currently include Ani, an anime avatar, and Rudy, a cartoony red panda.
11.)
Anthropic Launches Directory Connecting Claude To Popular Tools Like Notion, Canva, Figma, And Stripe
| Anthropic.com | July 14, 2025
Today, we are introducing a new directory of tools that connect to Claude, which you can explore and try with a single click. We are also featuring new connectors, built by our partners, to remote services like Notion, Canva, and Stripe and local desktop applications like Figma, Socket, and Prisma.
12.)
Anthropic Secures $200M DOD Agreement To Develop Advanced AI For U.S. Defense Operations
| Anthropic.com | July 14, 2025
The U.S. Department of Defense (DOD), through its Chief Digital and Artificial Intelligence Office (CDAO), has awarded Anthropic a two-year prototype other transaction agreement with a $200 million ceiling. As part of the agreement, Anthropic will prototype frontier AI capabilities that advance U.S. national security.
13.)
xAI Launches Grok For Government, Bringing Advanced AI Tools To Us Government Agencies
| X.ai | July 14, 2025
We are excited to announce Grok For Government ‚Äî a suite of frontier AI products available first to United States Government customers.
14.)
Facebook Boosts Feed Quality By Reducing Spam, Fake Profiles, And Unoriginal Content To AId Creators
| Creators.facebook.com | July 14, 2025
Recently, we launched a long-term initiative to make Feed more relevant and help authentic creators breakthrough, starting first by cracking down on spammy content. We‚Äôre making progress ‚Äî in the first half of 2025, we took action on around 500,000 accounts engaged in spammy behavior or fake engagement, applying measures ranging from demoting their comments and reducing the distribution of their content to preventing these accounts from monetizing. We also took down around 10 million profiles impersonating large content producers.
15.)
Kiro Launches Agentic IDE To Assist Developers From Prototype To Production
| Kiro.dev | July 14, 2025
I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôve been there: prompt, prompt, prompt, and you have a working application. It‚Äôs fun and feels like magic. But getting it to production requires more. What assumptions did the model make when building it? You guided the agent throughout, but those decisions aren‚Äôt documented. Requirements are fuzzy and you can‚Äôt tell if the application meets them. You can‚Äôt quickly understand how the system is designed and how that design will affect your environment and performance. Sometimes it‚Äôs better to take a step back, think through decisions, and you‚Äôll end up with a better application that you can easily maintain. That‚Äôs what Kiro helps you do with spec-driven development.
16.)
Amazon Unveils Kiro, A Claude-Powered AI Rival To Windsurf And Codex, Sparking Developer Interest
| Venturebeat.com | July 14, 2025
Amid the big news that Windsurf is being acquired by Cognition (after its founders went to Google), developers interested in AI-powered coding may be on the hunt for new alternatives.
17.)
Windsurf Announces Partnership With Cognition For Next Phase Of Company Growth
| Windsurf.com | July 14, 2025
We‚Äôre delighted to share that Windsurf is being acquired by Cognition. Our world-class team will be joining forces with the iconic company that created Devin, the world‚Äôs first autonomous software engineering agent. Our users and customers will remain in steady hands and enjoy better product innovation than ever. And finally, Windsurf‚Äôs unique IP will also become integrated into Cognition, helping the joint team continue to push the frontier of AI coding capabilities.
18.)
Anthropic, Google, Openai, xAI Awarded Up To $200M By Us Defense Department For AI Development
| Cnbc.com | July 14, 2025
The U.S. Department of Defense on Monday said it‚Äôs granting contract awards of up to $200 million to several AI companies. The DoD‚Äôs Chief Digital and Artificial Intelligence Office said the awards will help the agency accelerate its adoption of AI solutions. The recipients of the contract awards include Anthropic, Google, OpenAI and xAI.
19.)
Google Adds Featured Partner-Selected Notebooks To Notebooklm From The Atlantic And The Economist
| Blog.google | July 14, 2025
From science to Shakespeare, get advice from experts and call upon curated collections of information with featured notebooks in NotebookLM, available today.
20.)
xAI Launches Grok For Us Government With New Defense Department Contract
| X.com | July 14, 2025
Announcing Grok for Government ‚Äì a suite of products that make our frontier models available to United States Government customers. We are especially excited about two new partnerships for our US Government partners. 1.) A new contract from the US Department of Defense. 2.) Our products being available to purchase via the General Services Administration (GSA) schedule. This allows every federal government department, agency, or office, to purchase xAI products. We‚Äôre hiring mission driven engineers who want to join the cause.
July 13, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
21.)
The Industry Reacts to Grok 4!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 13, 2025
The launch of Grok 4 brings notable reactions from industry leaders and innovators in artificial intelligence, highlighting both its potential applications and implications. Insights from various experts reveal the developing landscape of AI integration and the prevailing sentiment surrounding this groundbreaking technology.
22.)
Almost Timely News: üóûÔ∏è Unconventional Deep Research Use Cases
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | July 13, 2025
Christopher Penn unveils strategies to harness the capabilities of AI deep research tools effectively. Utilizing the CASINO framework, he guides viewers through automating job hunts, conducting comprehensive competitive analysis, and identifying critical gaps in content strategies to enhance audience engagement.
July 12, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
23.)
AI News: Grok 4 Is Really Smart‚Ä¶ But It Also Kinda Sucks‚Ä¶
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | July 12, 2025
This week in AI brought a mix of exciting developments, highlighting new tools and models poised to change the landscape. Key announcements include the launch of Perplexity‚Äôs innovative Comet Browser and updates on OpenAI‚Äôs advancements, along with insights into the latest controversies surrounding Grok 4.
July 11, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
24.)
How To Train Your Robot
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 11, 2025
Hugging Face has released Mini Reachy, an open-source DIY robot priced at $299, which can be programmed in Python. This innovative robot, designed for ease of use and community interaction, aims to democratize robotics while integrating advanced AI capabilities for real-world interaction.
25.)
Grok 4 Fully Tested (Insane)
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 11, 2025
Grok 4 showcases remarkable performance against established benchmarks, raising questions about its actual operational efficacy. The exploration dives into various capabilities including coding, image generation, and creative writing, among others, presenting a comprehensive assessment of this cutting-edge tool.
26.)
I Tried Gemini In Google AI Studio‚Ä¶
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | July 11, 2025
Discover the enhanced capabilities of Google Gemini within AI Studio. Grace shares her experiences, showcasing practical features and unique functionalities that can significantly elevate your workflow and creativity.
27.)
Grok 4 Is Nearing AGI But‚Ä¶ Can Elon Get Out Of The Way?
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | July 11, 2025
Grok 4 has achieved significant milestones, successfully completing ‚ÄúHumanity‚Äôs Last Exam‚Äù benchmarks while reflecting on Grok 3‚Äôs infamous public collapse. The implications for AI development and Elon Musk‚Äôs reputation come into sharp focus as more advancements and controversies unfold in the rapidly evolving AI landscape.
28.)
Grok Apologizes For July 8 Incident, Investigates Root Cause Of AI Misbehavior
| X.com | July 11, 2025
Update on where has
@grok been & what happened on July 8th. First off, we deeply apologize for the horrific behavior that many experienced.
29.)
OpenAI Delays Open-Weight Model Launch For Additional Safety Tests
| X.com | July 11, 2025
We planned to launch our open-weight model next week. Wwe are delaying it; we need time to run additional safety tests and review high-risk areas. we are not yet sure how long it will take us. While we trust the community will build great things with this model, once weights are out, they can‚Äôt be pulled back. this is new for us and we want to get it right. Sorry to be the bearer of bad news; we are working super hard!
30.)
Higgsfield AI Integrates Google Veo 3 For Enhanced End-To-End AI Studio Features
| X.com | July 11, 2025
Higgsfield just integrated Google Veo 3. Soul ID & Veo 3 ‚Äì the most realistic, high-aesthetic, power duo. One subscription = fully end-to-end AI studio. Retweet this post to get a full guide in your DMs. And honestly, Higgsfield is all you need.
31.)
Deepmind Welcomes Windsurf Team Members, Including Mohansolo
| X.com | July 11, 2025
Big welcome to
@_mohansolo and others from the Windsurf team joining Deepmind.
32.)
Exists Launches Public Access To Generative AI-Powered 3D World Creation Platform
| GamesBeat.com | July 11, 2025
Exists, a generative AI company reimagining how virtual worlds are created, today launched its platform to the public.
33.)
Intel CEO Says Company Too Late In AI Race, Drops From Top 10 Amid Global Layoffs
| TomsHardware.com | July 11, 2025
Intel CEO says it‚Äôs ‚Äútoo late‚Äù for them to catch up with AI competition ‚Äî reportedly claims Intel has fallen out of the ‚Äútop 10 semiconductor companies‚Äù as the firm lays off thousands across the world
34.)
China‚Äôs Moonshot AI Launches Open-Source Model To Regain Domestic Market Share
| Reuters.com | July 11, 2025
Chinese artificial intelligence startup Moonshot AI released a new open-source AI model on Friday, joining a wave of similar releases from local rivals, as it seeks to reclaim its position in the competitive domestic market.
35.)
Black Forest Labs Launches Kontext Komposer For Effortless Image Transformation
| X.com | July 11, 2025
We just shipped the Kontext Komposer + Kontext-powered Presets. Transform any image without writing a single prompt.
July 10, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
36.)
Podcast: How To Use AI In Your Business
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 10, 2025
This podcast features an internationally recognized AI strategist who transformed his content workflow from several hours to just over a minute. Listeners learn insights on productivity, the value of AI, and specific tools for enhancing business efficiency, all while addressing questions around AI‚Äôs impact on productivity and quality.
37.)
WTF Is Up With Grok 4?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 10, 2025
Grok 4 has launched, claiming the title of the world‚Äôs smartest AI while facing scrutiny over controversial updates and incidents. The article explores both the advancements and criticisms surrounding Grok 4, including a backlash against its perceived political bias and problematic behavior in public interactions.
38.)
Grok 4 Is Here! And It‚Äôs The Best? (Livestream Reaction)
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 10, 2025
The xAI team unveiled Grok 4‚Äôs remarkable new features during a live event, leading to astonishing demonstrations of its capabilities. With audience interactions driving the excitement, the presentation showcased innovative functionalities that promise to reshape user experiences.
39.)
Grok 4 Is Really Smart‚Ä¶ Like Really Smart
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 10, 2025
Explore the groundbreaking capabilities of Grok 4, an all-in-one AI super assistant that promises to revolutionize the way users interact with technology. This AI agent demonstrates extraordinary intelligence and versatility, surpassing existing solutions in the market.
40.)
Grok 4 ‚Äì 10 New Things to Know
| AI Explained | YouTube.com | July 10, 2025
Grok 4 introduces significant changes and features that are critical for users and developers alike. The exploration covers benchmark insights, pricing strategies, and the anticipated Grok 5 developments, all delivered succinctly in under twelve minutes.
41.)
AI News: Grok 4, Grok 3 Off The Rails, OpenAI Poaching, New Open Source Models, And More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 10, 2025
In this insightful update, the latest developments in AI are explored, including the controversies surrounding Grok 4 and Grok 3, alongside OpenAI‚Äôs recruitment strategies and emerging open-source models. Additionally, discussions encompass key industry trends that shape the future of artificial intelligence technology.
42.)
Will AI Supercharge Our Output or Sink Our Standards?
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | July 10, 2025
Corey Noles and Grant Harvey engage with AI strategist Andreas Welsch to examine whether artificial intelligence enhances productivity or compromises quality in the quest for automation. Insights from industry leaders shed light on the implications of AI‚Äôs rapid advancement, emphasizing the need for critical skills and governance in a technology-driven landscape.
43.)
Video Game Actors‚Äô Strike Ends As Sag-Aftra Reaches AI Deal With Top Gaming Companies
| BBC.com | July 10, 2025
Video game actors have voted to end a year-long strike over artificial intelligence (AI) protections. About 2,500 members of US union SAG-Aftra were involved in the action against 10 of the biggest companies in the industry, including Activision and Electronic Arts.
44.)
Reka.AI Launches Flash 3.1 And Reka Quant For Multimodal AI Solutions
| Reka.ai | July 10, 2025
At Reka, we build intelligence from the ground up to power our multimodal solutions such as Reka Research and Reka Vision. Today, we are excited to open source a few of our building blocks.
45.)
Mistral AI Enhances Agentic Coding Capabilities With New Devstral Models
| Mistral.ai | July 10, 2025
Today, we introduce Devstral Medium, as well as an upgrade to Devstral Small. These models are released under the collaboration between Mistral AI and All Hands AI, with a strong emphasis on generalization to different prompts and agentic scaffolds.
46.)
Research: AI Model ‚ÄúASAMT‚Äù Creates Protein Structures At Different Temperatures
| Biorxiv.org | July 10, 2025
Following the sequence and structure revolutions, predicting the dynamical mechanisms of proteins that implement biological function remains an outstanding scientific challenge. Several experimental techniques and molecular dynamics (MD) simulations can, in principle, determine conformational states, binding configurations and their probabilities, but suffer from low throughput. Here we develop a Biomolecular Emulator (BioEmu), a generative deep learning system that can generate thousands of statistically independent samples from the protein structure ensemble per hour on a single graphical processing unit. By leveraging novel training methods and vast data of protein structures, over 200 milliseconds of MD simulation, and experimental protein stabilities, BioEmu‚Äôs protein ensembles represent equilibrium in a range of challenging and practically relevant metrics. Qualitatively, BioEmu samples many functionally relevant conformational changes, ranging from formation of cryptic pockets, over unfolding of specific protein regions, to large-scale domain rearrangements. Quantitatively, BioEmu samples protein conformations with relative free energy errors around 1 kcal/mol, as validated against millisecond-timescale MD simulation and experimentally-measured protein stabilities. By simultaneously emulating structural ensembles and thermodynamic properties, BioEmu reveals mechanistic insights, such as the causes for fold destabilization of mutants, and can efficiently provide experimentally-testable hypotheses.
47.)
OpenAI Quietly Adds Shopify As ChatGPT Shopping Search Partner
| SearchEngineJournal.com | July 10, 2025
OpenAI ChatGPT Search quietly expanded its shopping search features by including Shopify as a data provider.
48.)
xAI‚Äôs New Grok 4 Model Sets AI Benchmark Records With Enhanced Reasoning Capabilities
| SiliconAngle.com | July 10, 2025
Elon Musk‚Äôs xAI Holdings Corp. has debuted a new large language model, Grok 4, that‚Äôs optimized for reasoning tasks such as generating code.
49.)
Google‚Äôs Flow Adds Image Speech Feature With Veo 3, Expands AI Plans To 76 More Countries
| Blog.google | July 10, 2025
You can now make your images talk with Veo 3 in Flow, plus we‚Äôre expanding to more countries. Tens of millions of videos have been generated in Flow, our AI tool for filmmakers since launching in May. To help get the most out of Flow, starting this week, you can add speech to your clips in Flow when using Frames to Video. This feature lets you bring your own images to use as the starting frame of a video clip. Veo 3 already lets you add sound effects and background noise to these clips, and now you‚Äôll be able to generate speech as well. We‚Äôre also introducing Frames to Video on Veo 3 Fast, so you can get even more out of your credits. Audio generation in Flow is still experimental and we‚Äôre continuing to improve so results may vary.
50.)
Google Gemini Now Turns Uploaded Photos Into Videos Using Veo 3
| Blog.google | July 10, 2025
You can now transform your photos into eight-second videos using Veo 3.
51.)
Coinbase Partners With Perplexity AI For Enhanced Real-Time Crypto Data Access
| X.com | July 10, 2025
Exciting update: Coinbase has partnered with Perplexity to help traders get access to real-time trusted crypto data/info for better decision making. The first stage is going live today, and there‚Äôs more to come.
July 9, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
52.)
AI Voice Clones Get Political
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 9, 2025
AI voice clones are increasingly being used as tools for impersonation and deception, with significant implications in political contexts. The FBI has warned of an active campaign targeting U.S. officials using these technologies, raising concerns about security and verification methods in a tech-savvy world.
53.)
19 Free AI Tools You‚Äôve Gotta Try!
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | July 9, 2025
Explore a curated selection of innovative and free AI tools, including applications for video, image, and music generation, alongside productivity enhancements. From a Windows XP simulator to AI-driven creativity, each tool unlocks new possibilities for users eager to harness the power of artificial intelligence.
54.)
xAI Unveils Grok 4: World‚Äôs Most Powerful AI Model Launched Live
| X.com | July 9, 2025
Introducing Grok 4, the world‚Äôs most powerful AI model. Watch the livestream now.
55.)
OpenAI Hires 4 Top AI Engineers From Tesla, xAI, And Meta
| NewsBytesApp.com | July 9, 2025
OpenAI has hired four AI engineers and researchers from its competitors. The new recruits are David Lau, ex-Tesla VP of software engineering; Uday Ruddarraju, ex-xAI and X head of infrastructure engineering; Mike Dalton, another infrastructure engineer from xAI; and Angela Fan, an AI researcher from Meta. The news was confirmed by OpenAI‚Äôs co-founder and president Greg Brockman on X.
56.)
ZDNet: Heavy AI Use At Work Linked To Higher Burnout Risk, Study Finds
| ZDNet.com | July 9, 2025
AI may make you more productive, but it comes with a psychological cost.
57.)
Zoom Boosts AI Companion Productivity With Google Drive And Salesforce Integration
| ZDNet.com | July 9, 2025
AI Companion can now help you get more done with Google Drive, Salesforce, and more. Here‚Äôs how.
58.)
X Disables Grok Chatbot, Adjusts Prompts Following Antisemitic Incidents
| TechCrunch.com | July 9, 2025
Elon Musk‚Äôs X has taken the automated account for Grok, its AI chatbot, offline after it spent Tuesday afternoon pushing antisemitic narratives. This was not the first (nor the second) time that an incident like this has occurred.
59.)
YouTube To Tackle Mass-Produced, Repetitive Videos Amid Rising AI Concerns
| TechCrunch.com | July 9, 2025
YouTube is preparing to update its policies to crack down on creators‚Äô ability to generate revenue from ‚Äúinauthentic‚Äù content, including mass-produced videos and other types of repetitive content ‚Äî things that have become easier to generate with the help of AI technology.
60.)
OpenAI Acquires Jony Ive‚Äôs Io To Develop AI Hardware
| TheVerge.com | July 9, 2025
Sam Altman and Jony Ive‚Äôs plan to merge ChatGPT‚Äôs AI tech with new hardware devices is moving forward.
61.)
OpenAI Set To Launch New Open Language Model As Soon As Next Week
| TheVerge.com | July 9, 2025
Microsoft‚Äôs partnership with OpenAI could be facing yet another test.
62.)
Soundslice Creates Music Notation Feature After ChatGPT Falsely Claims It Exists
